마법 아이템 I (기본 & 제작)

MAGIC ITEMS I (BASICS & CREATION)

마법 아이템 are divided into categories: 갑옷, 무기, potions, 반지, 마법봉, 두루마리, 마법지팡이, 마법막대, and 고급 아이템. In addition, some 마법 아이템 are cursed or intelligent. Finally, a few 마법 아이템 are of such rarity and power that they are considered to belong to a category of their own: 유물. 유물 are classified in turn as minor (extremely rare but not one-of-a-kind items) or major (each one unique and extremely potent).

갑옷 및 방패: Magic 갑옷(including 방패) offers improved, magical protection to the wearer. Some of these items confer 능력 beyond a benefit to 방어도.

무기: 마법 무기 are created with a variety of 전투 powers and almost always improve 공격 and 피해 rolls of the wielder as well.

Potions: A potion is an elixir concocted with a spell-like effect that affects only the drinker.

반지: A ring is a circular metal band worn on the finger (no more than two 반지 per wearer) that has a spell-like power (often a constant effect that affects the wearer).

마법봉: A rod is a scepter-like item with a special power unlike that of any known spell.

두루마리: A scroll is a spell magically inscribed onto paper or parchment so that it can be used later.

마법지팡이: A staff has a number of different (but often related) spell effects. A newly created staff has 50 돌격, and each use of the staff depletes one or more of those 돌격.

마법막대: A wand is a short stick imbued with the power to cast a specific spell. A newly created wand has 50 돌격, and each use of the wand depletes one of those 돌격.

고급 아이템: These objects include magic jewelry, tools, books, 의류, and much more.

마법 아이템과 마법 감지

Magic Items and Detect Magic

When 마법 감지 identifies a magic item’s 학파 of magic, this information refers to 학파 of the spell placed within the potion, scroll, or wand, or the prerequisite given for the item. 묘사 of each item provides its aura 근력 and 학파 it belongs to.

If more than one spell is given as a prerequisite, use the highest-레벨 spell. If no 주문 are included in the 전제조건, use the following default guidelines.

Item Nature 학파
갑옷 and protection items 회피술
무기 or offensive items 강신술
보너스 to ability score, on skill check, etc. 변환술

아이템 사용

USING ITEMS

To use a magic item, it must be activated, although sometimes activation simply means putting a ring on your finger. Some items, once donned, function constantly. In most cases, using an item requires a standard action that does not provoke 기회 공격. By contrast, spell completion items are treated like 주문 in 전투 and do provoke 기회 공격.

Activating a magic item is a standard action unless the item 묘사 indicates otherwise. However, 시전 시간 of a spell is the time required to activate the same power in an item, regardless of the type of magic item, unless the item 묘사 specifically states otherwise.

The four ways to 마법 아이템 사용 are described below.

Spell Completion: This is the activation method for 두루마리. A scroll is a spell that is mostly finished. The preparation is done for the caster, so no preparation time is needed beforehand as with normal spellcasting. All that’s left to do is 공연 the finishing parts of the spellcasting (the final gestures, words, and so on). To use a spell completion item safely, a character must be of high enough 레벨 in the right class to cast the spell already. If he can’t already cast the spell, there’s a chance he’ll make a mistake. Activating a spell completion item is a standard action and provokes 기회 공격 exactly as casting a spell does.

Spell 트리거: Spell 트리거 activation is similar to spell completion, but it’s even simpler. No gestures or spell finishing is needed, just a special 지식 of spellcasting that an appropriate character would know, and a single word that must be spoken. Anyone with a spell on his or her spell list knows how to use a spell 트리거 item that stores that spell. (This is the case even for a character who can’t actually cast 주문, such as a 3rd-레벨 성기사.) The user must still determine what spell is stored in the item before she can activate it. Activating a spell 트리거 item is a standard action and does not provoke 기회 공격.

명령 Word: If no activation method is suggested either in the magic item 묘사 or by the nature of the item, assume that a 명령 word is needed to activate it. 명령 word activation means that a character 말하기 the word and the item activates. No other special 지식 is needed.

A 명령 word can be a real word, but when this is the case, the holder of the item 달리기 the risk of activating the item accidentally by speaking the word in normal conversation. More often, 명령 word is some seemingly nonsensical word, or a word or phrase from an ancient language no longer in common use. Activating a 명령 word magic item is a standard action and does not provoke 기회 공격.

Sometimes 명령 word to activate an item is written right on the item. Occasionally, it might be hidden within a pattern or design engraved on, carved into, or built into the item, or the item might bear a clue to 명령 word.

지식(arcana) and 지식(history) 스킬 might be useful in helping to 식별 명령 words or deciphering clues regarding them. A successful check against DC 30 is needed to come up with the word itself. If that check is failed, succeeding on a second check (DC 25) might provide some insight into a clue.

주문 식별 and 드웨머 분석 both reveal 명령 words.

Use Activated: This type of item simply has to be used in order to activate it. A character has to drink a potion, swing a sword, interpose a 방패 to deflect a blow in 전투, look through a lens, sprinkle dust, wear a ring, or don a hat. Use activation is generally straightforward and self-explanatory.

Many use-activated items are objects that a character wears. Continually functioning items are practically always items that one wears. A few must simply be in the character’s possession (on his person). However, some items made for wearingmust still be activated. Although this activation sometimes requires a 명령 word (see above), usually it means mentally willing the activation to happen. 묘사 of an item states whether a 명령 word is needed in such a case.

Unless stated otherwise, activating a use-activated magic item is either a standard action or not an action at all and does not provoke 기회 공격, unless the use involves performing an action that provokes an 공격 of opportunity in itself. If the use of the item takes time before a magical effect occurs, then use activation is a standard action. If the item’s activation is subsumed in its use and takes no extra time use activation is not an action at all.

Use activation doesn’t mean that if you use an item, you automatically know what it can do. You must know (or at least guess) what the item can do and then use the item in order to activate it, unless the benefit of the item comes automatically, such from drinking a potion or swinging a sword.

크기와 마법 아이템

SIZE AND MAGIC ITEMS

When an article of magic 의류 or jewelry is discovered, most of the time size shouldn’t be an issue. Many magic garments are made to be easily adjustable, or they adjust themselves magically to the wearer. Size should not keep characters of various kinds from using 마법 아이템.

There may be rare exceptions, especially with racial specific items.

갑옷 and Weapon Sizes: 갑옷 and 무기 that are found at random have a 30% chance of being Small (01–30), a 60% chance of being Medium (31–90), and a 10% chance of being any other size (91–100).

착용 가능한 마법 아이템

MAGIC ITEMS ON THE BODY

Many 마법 아이템 need to be donned by a character who wants to employ them or benefit from their 능력. It’s possible for a creature with a humanoid-shaped body to wear as many as twelve 마법 아이템 at the same time. However, each of those items must be worn on (or over) a particular part of the body.

A humanoid-shaped body can be decked out in magic gear consisting of one item from each of the following groups, keyed to which place on the body the item is worn.

• One headband, hat, helmet, or phylactery on the head

• One pair of eye lenses or goggles on or over the eyes

• One 아뮬렛, brooch, medallion, necklace, periapt, or scarab around the neck

• One vest, vestment, or shirt on the torso

• One robe or suit of 갑옷 on the body (over a vest, vestment, or shirt)

• One belt around the waist (over a robe or suit of 갑옷)

• One cloak, cape, or mantle around the shoulders (over a robe or suit of 갑옷)

• One pair of bracers or bracelets on the arms or wrists

• One glove, pair of gloves, or pair of gauntlets on the hands

• One ring on each hand (or two 반지 on one hand)

• One pair of boots or shoes on the feet

Of course, a character may carry or possess as many items of the same type as he 소원. However, additional items beyond those listed above have no effect.

Some itemscan be worn or carried without taking up space on a character’s body. 묘사 of an item indicates when an item has this property.

마법 아이템이 가진 힘에 대한 내성 굴림

SAVING THROWS AGAINST MAGIC ITEM POWERS

마법 아이템 produce 주문 or spell-like effects. For a 내성 굴림 against a spell or spell-like effect from a magic item, the DC is 10 + 레벨 of the spell or effect + the ability 수정치 of the minimum ability score needed to cast that 레벨 of spell.

마법지팡이 are an exception to the rule. Treat 내성 굴림 as if the wielder cast the spell, including 시전자 레벨 and all 수정치 to save DC.

Most item 묘사 give 내성 굴림 DCs for various effects, particularly when the effect has no exact spell equivalent (making its 레벨 otherwise difficult to determine quickly).

마법 아이템의 피해

DAMAGING MAGIC ITEMS

A magic item doesn’t need to make a 내성 굴림 unless it is unattended, it is specifically targeted by the effect, or its wielder rolls a natural 1 on his save. 마법 아이템 should always get a 내성 굴림 against 주문 that might deal 피해 to them— even against 공격 from which a nonmagical item would normally get no chance to save. 마법 아이템 use the same 내성 굴림 보너스 for all 내성 굴림, no matter what the type (Fortitude, Reflex, or Will). A magic item’s 내성 굴림 보너스 equals 2 + one-half its 시전자 레벨(round down). The only exceptions to this are intelligent 마법 아이템, which make Will 내성 굴림 based on their own 지혜 scores.

마법 아이템, unless otherwise noted, take 피해 as nonmagical items of the same sort. A damaged magic item continues to function, but if it is destroyed, all its magical power is lost.

마법 아이템의 수리

REPAIRING MAGIC ITEMS

Some 마법 아이템 take 피해 over the course of an adventure. It costs no more to repair a magic item with the 제작 skill than it does to repair its nonmagical counterpart. The 완전 수리 spell also repairs a damaged—but not completely broken—magic item.

지능있는 아이템

INTELLIGENT ITEMS

Some 마법 아이템, particularly 무기, have an 지능 all their own. Only permanent 마법 아이템(as opposed to those with a single use or those with 돌격) can be intelligent. (This means that potions, 두루마리, and 마법막대, among other items, are never intelligent.)

In general, less than 1% of 마법 아이템 have 지능.

저주 받은 아이템

CURSED ITEMS

Some items are cursed—incorrectly made, or corrupted by outside forces. 저주 받은 아이템 might be particularly dangerous to the user, or they might be normal items with a minor flaw, an inconvenient requirement, or an unpredictable nature. Randomly generated items are cursed 5% of the time.

충전, 용량, 다회 사용

CHARGES, DOSES, AND MULTIPLE USES

Many items, particularly 마법막대 and 마법지팡이, are limited in power by the number of 돌격 they hold. Normally, charged items have 50 돌격 at most. If such an item is found as a random part of a 전리품, roll d% and divide by 2 to determine the number of 돌격 left (round down, minimum 1). If the item has a maximum number of 돌격 other than 50, roll randomly to determine how many 돌격 are left.

Prices listed are always for fully charged items. (When an item is created, it is fully charged.) For an item that’s worthless when its 돌격 달리기 out (which is the case for almost all charged items), the value of the partially used item is proportional to the number of 돌격 left. For an item that has usefulness in addition to its 돌격, only part of the item’s value is based on the number of 돌격 left.

마법 아이템 설명

MAGIC ITEM DESCRIPTIONS

Each general type of magic item gets an overall 묘사, followed by 묘사 of specific items.

General 묘사 include notes on activation, random generation, and other material. The AC, hardness, 히트 포인트, and break DC are given for typical examples of some 마법 아이템. The AC assumes that the item is unattended and includes a –5 페널티 for the item’s effective 민첩 of 0. If a creature holds the item, use the creature’s 민첩 수정치 in place of the –5 페널티.

Some individual items, notably those that simply store 주문 and nothing else, don’t get full-blown 묘사. Reference the spell’s 묘사 for details, modified by the form of the item (potion, scroll, wand, and so on). Assume that the spell is cast at the minimum 레벨 required to cast it

Items with full 묘사 have their powers detailed, and each of the following topics is covered in notational form at the end of 묘사.

• Aura: Most of the time, a 마법 감지 spell will reveal 학파 of magic associated with a magic item and 근력 of the aura an item emits. This information (when applicable) is given at the beginning of the item’s notational entry. See the 마법 감지 spell descriptionfor details.

• 시전자 레벨: The next item in a notational entry gives 시전자 레벨 of the item, indicating its relative power. 시전자 레벨 determines the item’s 내성 굴림 보너스, as well as 거리 or other 레벨-dependent aspects of the powers of the item (if variable). It also determines 레벨 that must be contended with should the item come under the effect of a 마법 무효화 spell or similar situation. This information is given in the form “CL x,” where “CL” is an abbreviation for 시전자 레벨 and “x” is an ordinal number representing 시전자 레벨 itself.

For potions, 두루마리, and 마법막대, the creator can set 시전자 레벨 of an item at any number high enough to cast the stored spell and not higher than her own 시전자 레벨. For other 마법 아이템, 시전자 레벨 is determined by the item itself. In this case, the creator’s 시전자 레벨 must be as high as the item’s 시전자 레벨(and 전제조건 may effectively put a higher minimum on the creator’s 레벨).

• 전제조건: Certain 필요조건 must be met in order for a character to create a magic item. These include 특기, 주문, and 기타 필요조건 such as 레벨, 성향, and race or kind. 전제조건 for creation of an item are given immediately following the item’s 시전자 레벨.

A spell prerequisite may be provided by a character who has prepared the spell (or who knows the spell, in the case of a 소서러 or 음유시인), or through the use of a spell completion or spell 트리거 magic item or a spell-like ability that produces the desired spell effect. For each day that passes in the creation process, the creator must expend one spell completion item or one 돌격 from a spell 트리거 item if either of those objects is used to supply a prerequisite.

It is possible for more than one character to cooperate in the creation of an item, with each participant providing one or more of 전제조건. In some cases, cooperation may even be necessary.

If two or more characters cooperate to create an item, they must agree among themselves who will be considered the creator for 목적 of determinations where the creator’s 레벨 must be known. The character designated as the creator pays the XP required to make the item.

Typically, a list of 전제조건 includes one feat and one or more 주문(or some other requirement in addition to the feat).

When two 주문 at the end of a list are separated by “or,” one of those 주문 is required in addition to every other spell mentioned prior to the last two.

• 시장 가격: This gold piece value, given following the word “Price,” represents the price someone should expect to pay to buy the item. 시장 가격 for an item that can be constructed with an item creation feat is usually equal to the base price plus the price for any 구성요소(material or XP).

• Cost to Create: The next part of a notational entry is the cost in gp and XP to create the item, given following the word

“Cost.” This information appears only for items with 구성요소(material or XP), which make their 시장 가격 higher than their base prices. The cost to create includes the costs derived from the base cost plus the costs of 구성요소.

Items without 구성요소 do not have a “Cost” entry. For them, 시장 가격 and the base price are the same. The cost in gp is 1/2 시장 가격, and the cost in XP is 1/25 시장 가격.

• Weight: The notational entry for many 고급 아이템 ends with a value for the item’s weight. When a weight figure is not given, the item has no weight worth noting (for 목적 of determining how much of a load a character can carry).

마법 아이템 제작

CREATING MAGIC ITEMS

To create 마법 아이템, spellcasters use special 특기. They invest time, money, and their own personal energy (in the form of experience points) in an item’s creation.

Note that all items have 전제조건 in their 묘사. These 전제조건 must be met for the item to be created. Most of the time, they take the form of 주문 that must be known by the item’s creator (although access through another magic item or spellcaster is allowed).

While item creation costs are handled in detail below, note that normally the two primary factors are the 시전자 레벨 of the creator and 레벨 of the spell or 주문 put into the item. A creator can create an item at a lower 시전자 레벨 than her own, but never lower than the minimum 레벨 needed to cast the needed spell. Using 메타마법 특기, a caster can place 주문 in items at a higher 레벨 than normal.

Magic supplies for items are always half of the base price in gp and 1/25 of the base price in XP. For many items, 시장 가격 equals the base price.

갑옷, 방패, 무기, and items with a value independent of their magically enhanced properties add their item cost to 시장 가격. The item cost does not influence the base price (which determines the cost of magic supplies and 경험치 비용), but it does increase the final 시장 가격.

In addition, some items cast or replicate 주문 with costly material 구성요소 or with XP 구성요소. For these items, 시장 가격 equals the base price plus an extra price for the spell component costs. Each XP in the component costs adds 5 gp to 시장 가격. The cost to create these items is the magic supplies cost and the base XP cost (both determined by the base price) plus the costs for 구성요소. 묘사 of these items include an entry that gives the total cost of creating the item.

The creator also needs a fairly quiet, comfortable, and well-lit place in which to work. Any place suitable for preparing 주문 is suitable for making items. Creating an item requires one day per 1,000 gp in the item’s base price, with a minimum of at least one day. Potions are an exception to this rule; they always take just one day to brew. The character must spend the gold and XP at the beginning of 제작 process.

The caster works for 8 hours each day. He cannot rush the process by working longer each day. But the days need not be consecutive, and the caster can use the rest of his time as he sees fit.

A character can work on only one item at a time. If a character starts work on a new item, all materials used and XP spent on the under-제작 item are wasted.

The secrets of creating 유물 are long lost.

Many factors must be considered when determining the price of new 마법 아이템. The easiest way to come up with a price is to match the new item to an item that is already priced that price as a guide. Otherwise, use the guidelines summarized on 표: Estimating Magic Item Gold Piece Values.

Multiple Similar 능력: For items with multiple similar 능력 that don’t take up space on a character’s body use the following formula: Calculate the price of the single most costly ability, then add 75% of the value of the next most costly ability, plus one-half the value of any other 능력.

For items that do take up a space on a character’s body each additional power not only has no discount but instead has a 50% increase in price.

0-레벨 주문: When 곱하기 spell 레벨 to determine value, 0- 레벨 주문 should be treated as 1/2 레벨.

Other Considerations: Once you have a final cost figure, reduce that number if either of the following 상태이상 applies:

—Item Requires Skill to Use: Some items require a specific skill to get them to function. This factor should reduce the cost about 10%.

—Item Requires Specific Class or 성향 to Use: Even more restrictive than requiring a skill, this limitation cuts the cost by 30%.

Prices presented in 마법 아이템 설명(the gold piece value following the item’s 시전자 레벨) are the market value, which is generally twice what it costs the creator to make the item.

An item is only worth two times what the caster of lowest possible 레벨 can make it for. Calculate 시장 가격 based on the lowest possible 레벨 caster, no matter who makes the item.

Not all items adhere to these formulas directly. The reasons for this are several. First and foremost, these few formulas aren’t enough to truly gauge the exact differences between items. The price of a magic item may be modified based on its actual worth. The formulas only provide a starting point. The pricing of 두루마리 assumes that, whenever possible, a 마법사 or 사제 created it. Potions and 마법막대 follow the formulas exactly. 마법지팡이 follow the formulas closely, and other items require at least some judgment calls.
